page.title: 01The Thornton/Pickering Area
page.content: The area consists of the gentle south facing dipslope of the limestone{ {Tabular Hills.}Cutting through in a NE-SW direction is the deep,steep- sided glacial overflow channel of{ {Newton Dale.}The southwest corner contains the modern residential and industrial outskirts of{Pickering.}The southeast corner contains the majority of the village of{Thornton Dale,}which lies within the{North York Moors } National Park. Its population has recently expanded with the influx of retired people, and tourism has developed as the village has become a popular halt for coach trips. The area is extensively used for cereal farming with some land devoted to forestry and quarrying. Other employment comes from services,tourism,and light industry which has been developed on a CoSIRA estate on the outskirts of Pickering.
